title: Escape to Herefordshire With New Tour Business Rural Concierge
text:
Rural Concierge
HEREFORD, England , October 9, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --
http://www.rural-concierge.co.uk
Have you ever tasted Tyrrells Crisps, Chase Vodka, Wye Valley Beer, Bulmers Cider, Westons Stowford Press, Gwatkins Perry or beef from the famous Hereford cattle?
All of these originate from a rural undiscovered county called Herefordshire.
Join Rural Concierge and escape busy life. Visit this picturesque area where there are no motorways or big attractions - just peace and quiet.
Herefordshire based Rural Concierge works together with a number of tourism businesses and tour guides to create a selection of tours and itineraries to showcase the best the area has to offer.
" You can stroll around our picturesque black and white villages, take a riverside walk, have a picnic. Try your hand at pottery, making cheese, feeding a goat, walking an Alpaca, climbing a tree.... The options are endless!" says Liz Hill , owner of Rural Concierge.
" I want to make it as easy and stress free as possible for people to book a visit to this scenic, yet quirky area. "
Arrive by car, train, bus or on foot - Come and meet some of the farmers, growers and producers who live and work here - do some tasting!
No tour is ever the same; depending on the time of year, we can arrange a visit to a village fete, a winter Wassail, a dragon boat race or the opportunity to make your own Herefordshire cider.
There's more!!
Literature & Music Fans
Why not follow in the footsteps of Sir Edward Elgar , Sir Arthur Conan Doyle , William and Dorothy Wordsworth , Revd. Francis Kilvert , Thomas Traherne, John Masefield , Elizabeth Barratt Browning and the more recent Phil Rickman - all of them inspired by their time in Herefordshire.
Church Explorers
Herefordshire has a wonderful array of medieval churches with ancient stained glass, Norman carvings and amazing monuments - find out the mysterious stories about Black Vaughan, Blanche de Grandisson , Constanzia who gave her hand for her husband's life....
See how we live in a rural countryside setting and meet the friendly locals.
Liz specialises in researching and creating quality sightseeing itineraries, tours & talks not only in Herefordshire but also in surrounding areas. These include the Wye Valley, the Marches , the Cotswolds, the Midlands , Wales and the South West.
These one-day tours, group visits and overnight stays can be booked online, over the telephone or in Hereford High Town Butter Market at the Rural Concierge kiosk.
A small sample of Herefordshire-themed breaks and day trips includes:
The Herefordshire Cider & Perry Tour
The Black & White Villages of Herefordshire
The Literary Trail of Herefordshire
Herefordshire ' s Hidden Villages & Churches
Escape to Herefordshire Tour
